meanings.definition: Selective or fussy in choosing or accepting
meanings.sent1: She is very picky about the food she eats.
meanings.sent2: He can be picky when it comes to selecting his clothes.
meanings.sent3: The picky cat refused to eat any food that wasn't fresh.
meanings.sent4: Her picky nature when it comes to books makes her a tough critic.
meanings.sent5: The picky eater only liked his sandwiches with the crusts cut off.

meanings.definition: Showing great care or attention to detail
meanings.sent1: The artist was picky about every brushstroke in his painting.
meanings.sent2: She has a picky eye for spotting errors in documents.
meanings.sent3: The picky inspector examined every inch of the building.
meanings.sent4: His picky craftsmanship resulted in a beautifully detailed sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The picky gardener meticulously tended to each flower in the garden.

meanings.definition: Easily irritated or annoyed by small things
meanings.sent1: She becomes picky when the room is not arranged as she likes.
meanings.sent2: He gets picky if his schedule is disrupted.
meanings.sent3: The picky customer complained about the smallest imperfection.
meanings.sent4: His picky attitude towards noise made him wear earplugs everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The picky child threw a tantrum when his toys were not in order.
